The likely -near term- impact of high # bitcoin fees is turning to centralized systems, pause for year+ while Lightning etc. built out.
Absent that, the digital gold hodlers need to attract new users, grow the network effect, and high fees run counter to that longterm need.
If # Bitcoin catches on as a non correlated asset class - digital gold - it can likely survive high fees and low transaction volume. Big "if"
. @ Ethan_Heilman @ el33th4xor Yes, many miners are long # bitcoin - and kudos to them for investing in the system in an incentive-aligned way.

In contrast, CLTV or CSV soft fork does not directly change supply economics.
a2) Soft forks req only tiny few to agree, to change supply. Risky to exercise that; encourages clique as supply gatekeepers.
a1) Correct. e.g. SegWit changes max capacity of inelastic, previously fixed supply of block space.
. @ Ethan_Heilman Agree that SegWit should be a hard fork, though that logic derives from risks of economic soft fork.
. @ Ethan_Heilman One of the nice things about a minimal block size hard fork is that many SPV clients etc. keep working.
